channel.title: Royal Wedding
channel.description:
Just wanted to know if any one is watching it and what they think of it.
This is our futre queen ;D

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

LilXCj:

Seriously? Give us media coverage on something more important for our future.

There’s plenty of real news/media-more-important-for-our-future if you’d open a newspaper or search for it.

But it’s predicted that the royal wedding was to have up to 2 billion viewers. So obviously a large amount of people were interested in this. That’s why people like you and me have a choice which news we want to read.

Read full topic

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

xxlukexx:

The only good thing about today was that we got the day off…

i totally agree, i didn’t watch the ceremony and it’s only now that i have even started to speak about it. I’m english and really dont care about the wedding however i understand that for some it’s a very important event. I mean people camped outside west minster abbey so that they could watch the ceremony.

Read full topic

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote="-Dabb, post:25, topic:393055"][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=490226.msg3584667#msg3584667 date=1304073219]
It’s retarded.

No offense to those who live in England but… yeah.
[/quote]

If you where from England you would understand[/quote]

If I were from England, I would still not give a crap. Simply because I detest media about celebrities in which have nothing to do with us.

“Celeb has baby!”
“Celeb lost weight!”
“Celeb has no fashion sense!”
“Celeb comes out of the closet!”
“Prince William gets married to a commoner!”

Seriously? Give us media coverage on something more important for our future.

Read full topic

item.description:

in the name of the Father,
The Son and
The Holy Spirit.

but for the way they pray is this:
In the name of the Father,
The Son and
The Holy Ghost?

who is the ghost?[/quote]
I would imagine that it being the same as stating the ‘Holy Spirit’. Correct me if I’m wrong, I do believe ghost and spirit is the same in the terms it may be used.

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Mack n cheese, post:48, topic:393055”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=490226.msg3585164#msg3585164 date=1304117953]
The only good thing about today was that we got the day off…
[/quote]woah, you got the day off because two political puppets got married?

what the fuck.[/quote]
It’s because it has to do with something showing like honor or being polite or something, I believe nothing was suppose to run during that time, I’m not sure, not from the United Kingdom.

Nevertheless, I must admit the bride was quite gorgeous and it kind of amazed me the person she was going to marry. Then again, people can’t help whom they fall in love with. In all consideration as much as I don’t care, I have to give them credit because of the tradition continuing.

Read full topic

item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I’m utterly amazed at the ignorance in this thread. Most of you have no idea what you are even talking about when it comes to the Royal Family and their situation. But it’s Moparscape, I forget that sometimes.

Anyways, even though I’m American it was a nice event. Catherine is stunning and that’s about it.

Read full topic

American Media: ATTENTION ALL CHANNELS! IMMEDIATE COVERAGE, GO!

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:37, topic:393055”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=490226.msg3584885#msg3584885 date=1304092638]
This is the stupidest thing ever, I mean its in American we haven’t liked the UK since before 1776 why the hell should we care.
[/quote]

Because as much as America wishes to detach itself from the rest of the planet, YA CANT[/quote]I don’t care about detaching our selves, I just don’t see why the USA should review or even care about the wedding, I mean I get that its a important event for the UK but still.

Read full topic

item.title: Royal Wedding
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:16, topic:393055”][quote author=-Dabb link=topic=490226.msg3584689#msg3584689 date=1304074562]

Why is everyone so like giddy about this? Its a wedding of two ugly people in a country thats to stupid (no offence to English people) to realize that having a king and queen that have absolute power is the worst idea ever.

King and queen FTW
[/quote]
You wont be saying FTW when you get a king that wants to take everyones money so your all poor and then the USA assassinates the king and brings democracy to you.[/quote]
Hi mr ignorant. The british monarchy don’t “take everyones money”, they make more than they spend…

Anyway, as mentioned before, the government, ruled by the prime minister is in charge of the country: they make the laws and we have to follow them. Traditionally the queen has to sign every bill passed in parliament to make it an official law but since she has no choice it means she has no power over the government at all.

Read full topic

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:38, topic:393055”]Democracy? The only thing the USA brings after a war is the oil drills.[/quote]I think that’s the first thing I agree on with you Tom lol

Read full topic

Why is everyone so like giddy about this? Its a wedding of two ugly people in a country thats to stupid (no offence to English people) to realize that having a king and queen that have absolute power is the worst idea ever.

King and queen FTW
[/quote]
You wont be saying FTW when you get a king that wants to take everyones money so your all poor and then the USA assassinates the king and brings democracy to you.[/quote]
